body.p:
Maysville Ky
Dec 28t 1864
Hon. Thos. E. Bramlett
Governor of Ky
Frankfort,
Dear Sir,

We tak- great pleasure in recommending our friend Col. Arthur F. Dobyn to executive clemency, he having been fined at the last term of our court, for permitting gaming on his premises, Col. D -- is a man of evasive social qualities, and all these were proven against him mostly made out a technichal case; that is three gentlemen, his neighbors, visiting at his house, played games
of cards for amusement, having small stakes, to keep the games, There was no intention or thought of violating any law, or of gaming, as it turned, a mere pastime, to while away the hours -- His punishment will be severe enough, in compelling him to pay costs, and the atty's part of the fine,
We would esteem it a favour to us personally, and we believe the demands of the law, would be fully satisfied, if you would remit this extremely onerous fines under the circumstances

most resp'y your
ob't serv't,
Stanton & Throop
